problem.markdown: What is true for constant pressure gas thermometers? [x] To define a temperature scale, we need to have some arbitrary fixed points. [ ] The variation of volume with temperature does not depend on the gas used. [x] The scale is dependent on the pressure chosen. [x] It works better at lower pressures than higher pressures
problem.p: What is true for constant pressure gas thermometers?

checkboxgroup.choice: To define a temperature scale, we need to have some arbitrary fixed points.
The variation of volume with temperature does not depend on the gas used.
The scale is dependent on the pressure chosen.
It works better at lower pressures than higher pressures
